# selectedSegmentIndex

**Instance Property**

The index number that identifies the selected segment that the user last touched.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var selectedSegmentIndex: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISegmentedControl/noSegment] (no segment selected) until the user touches a segment. Set this property to `-1` to turn off the current selection. [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISegmentedControl] ignores this property when [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISegmentedControl/isMomentary] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. When the user touches a segment to change the selection, the system generates the control event [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/Event/valueChanged]. If you set up the segmented control to respond to this control event, it sends an action message to its target.

## Managing segments

- **numberOfSegments**: Returns the number of segments the segmented control has.
- **segmentIndex(identifiedBy:)**: The index of a segment with an action that has an identifier matching the identifier you specify.
- **insertSegment(action:at:animated:)**: Insert a segment with the action you specify at the given index.
- **insertSegment(with:at:animated:)**: Inserts a segment at the position you specify and gives it an image as content.
- **insertSegment(withTitle:at:animated:)**: Inserts a segment at the position you specify and gives it a title as content.
- **removeAllSegments()**: Removes all segments of the segmented control.
- **removeSegment(at:animated:)**: Removes the segment you specify from the segmented control, optionally animating the transition.
- **noSegment**: A segment index value indicating that there’s no selected segment.
